### Zeroday Cloud hacking event awards $320,0000 for 11 zero days


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The recent Zeroday Cloud hacking event concluded with participants being awarded a total of $320,000 for discovering 11 zero-day vulnerabilities. The event aimed to identify critical security flaws in widely used cloud services and platforms. Hackers and cybersecurity experts were tasked with finding and exploiting these vulnerabilities, which could have posed significant security risks if left undetected. The discoveries are expected to help improve the overall security of cloud services, as developers will now be able to address and patch these vulnerabilities. This event highlights the

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/zeroday-cloud-hacking-event-awards-320-0000-for-11-zero-days/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_8637)**

### Adjudicator: Correcting Noisy Labels with a KG-Informed Council of LLM Agents


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The article introduces "Adjudicator," a novel approach to improving machine learning model accuracy by correcting noisy labels using a knowledge-graph-informed council of large language model (LLM) agents. This method leverages the expertise of multiple LLMs, each possessing different strengths, to assess and rectify erroneous labels in datasets, thus enhancing data quality. The Adjudicator system utilizes a knowledge graph to inform and guide the decision-making process of these LLM agents, ensuring more reliable and precise label corrections.

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://arxiv.org/abs/2512.13704?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_5124)**
